title: Example: Policy Evaluation

definitions.Always Go Right: A policy where the agent always chooses the right action in each state.
definitions.Always Go Forward: A policy where the agent always chooses the forward action in each state.

formulas: Value of a state under a policy is the sum of the immediate reward and the discounted value of the next state.
summary: The slide presents a comparison of two policies, 'Always Go Right' and 'Always Go Forward', using a grid of states with rewards. The 'Always Go Right' policy shows a higher reward in one state, while the 'Always Go Forward' policy shows a higher reward in another state.
